types.name: ApiVersion
types.description:
A version of the API, as defined by [Shopify API versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).
Versions are commonly referred to by their handle (for example, `2021-10`).

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: The human-readable name of the version.

fields.name: handle
fields.description: The unique identifier of an ApiVersion. All supported API versions have a date-based (YYYY-MM) or `unstable` handle.

fields.name: supported
fields.description: Whether the version is actively supported by Shopify. Supported API versions are guaranteed to be stable. Unsupported API versions include unstable, release candidate, and end-of-life versions that are marked as unsupported. For more information, refer to [Versioning](https://shopify.dev/api/usage/versioning).

fields.description: The Order Status Page for this Checkout, null when checkout is not completed.

fields.description: The amount left to be paid. This is equal to the cost of the line items, taxes and shipping minus discounts and gift cards.

fields.description: The amount left to be paid. This is equal to the cost of the line items, duties, taxes and shipping minus discounts and gift cards.

fields.name: ready
fields.description:
Whether or not the Checkout is ready and can be completed. Checkouts may
have asynchronous operations that can take time to finish. If you want
to complete a checkout or ensure all the fields are populated and up to
date, polling is required until the value is true.

fields.description: States whether or not the fulfillment requires shipping.

fields.description: Whether taxes are included in the line item and shipping line prices.

types.name: CheckoutErrorCode
types.description: Possible error codes that can be returned by `CheckoutUserError`.

enumValues.name: BAD_DOMAIN
enumValues.description: Input email contains an invalid domain name.

enumValues.name: CART_DOES_NOT_MEET_DISCOUNT_REQUIREMENTS_NOTICE
enumValues.description: Cart does not meet discount requirements notice.

enumValues.name: CUSTOMER_ALREADY_USED_ONCE_PER_CUSTOMER_DISCOUNT_NOTICE
enumValues.description: Customer already used once per customer discount notice.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_ALREADY_APPLIED
enumValues.description: Gift card has already been applied.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_CURRENCY_MISMATCH
enumValues.description: Gift card currency does not match checkout currency.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_DEPLETED
enumValues.description: Gift card has no funds left.

enumValues.name: GIFT_CARD_UNUSABLE
enumValues.description: Gift card cannot be applied to a checkout that contains a gift card.

enumValues.name: GREATER_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be greater than or equal to the minimum value allowed.

enumValues.name: INVALID_COUNTRY_AND_CURRENCY
enumValues.description: Cannot specify country and presentment currency code.

enumValues.name: INVALID_FOR_COUNTRY
enumValues.description: Input Zip is invalid for country provided.

enumValues.name: INVALID_FOR_COUNTRY_AND_PROVINCE
enumValues.description: Input Zip is invalid for country and province provided.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LESS_THAN_OR_EQUAL_TO
enumValues.description: The input value should be less than or equal to the maximum value allowed.

enumValues.name: LINE_ITEM_NOT_FOUND
enumValues.description: Line item was not found in checkout.

enumValues.name: PRESENT
enumValues.description: The input value needs to be blank.

enumValues.name: TOO_LONG
enumValues.description: The input value is too long.

enumValues.name: TOTAL_PRICE_MISMATCH
enumValues.description: The amount of the payment does not match the value to be paid.

types.name: Image
types.description: Represents an image resource.

fields.name: altText
fields.description: A word or phrase to share the nature or contents of an image.

fields.name: height
fields.description: The original height of the image in pixels. Returns `null` if the image is not hosted by Shopify.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique identifier for the image.

fields.name: originalSrc
fields.description:
The location of the original image as a URL.

If there are any existing transformations in the original source URL, they will remain and not be stripped.

fields.name: src
fields.description: The location of the image as a URL.

fields.name: transformedSrc
fields.description:
The location of the transformed image as a URL.

All transformation arguments are considered "best-effort". If they can be applied to an image, they will be.
Otherwise any transformations which an image type does not support will be ignored.

args.name: crop
args.description: Crops the image according to the specified region.

args.name: maxHeight
args.description: Image height in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: maxWidth
args.description: Image width in pixels between 1 and 5760.

args.name: preferredContentType
args.description: Best effort conversion of image into content type (SVG -> PNG, Anything -> JPG, Anything -> WEBP are supported).

args.name: scale
args.description: Image size multiplier for high-resolution retina displays. Must be between 1 and 3.

fields.name: url
fields.description:
The location of the image as a URL.

If no transform options are specified, then the original image will be preserved including any pre-applied transforms.

All transformation options are considered "best-effort". Any transformation that the original image type doesn't support will be ignored.

If you need multiple variations of the same image, then you can use [GraphQL aliases](https://graphql.org/learn/queries/#aliases).

args.name: transform
args.description: A set of options to transform the original image.

fields.name: width
fields.description: The original width of the image in pixels. Returns `null` if the image is not hosted by Shopify.

This interface is used by the [node](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/queries/node)
and [nodes](https://shopify.dev/api/admin-graphql/unstable/queries/nodes) queries.

fields.description: The URL used for viewing the resource on the shop's Online Store. Returns `null` if the resource is currently not published to the Online Store sales channel.

types.name: Order
types.description: An order is a customer’s completed request to purchase one or more products from a shop. An order is created when a customer completes the checkout process, during which time they provides an email address, billing address and payment information.

fields.name: cancelReason
fields.description: The reason for the order's cancellation. Returns `null` if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: canceledAt
fields.description: The date and time when the order was canceled. Returns null if the order wasn't canceled.

fields.name: currencyCode
fields.description: The code of the currency used for the payment.

fields.name: currentSubtotalPrice
fields.description: The subtotal of line items and their discounts, excluding line items that have been removed. Does not contain order-level discounts, duties, shipping costs, or shipping discounts. Taxes are not included unless the order is a taxes-included order.

fields.name: currentTotalDuties
fields.description: The total cost of duties for the order, including refunds.

fields.name: currentTotalPrice
fields.description: The total amount of the order, including duties, taxes and discounts, minus amounts for line items that have been removed.

fields.name: currentTotalTax
fields.description: The total of all taxes applied to the order, excluding taxes for returned line items.

fields.name: customerLocale
fields.description: The locale code in which this specific order happened.

fields.name: customerUrl
fields.description: The unique URL that the customer can use to access the order.

fields.name: discountApplications
fields.description: Discounts that have been applied on the order.

types.name: OrderFulfillmentStatus
types.description: Represents the order's aggregated fulfillment status for display purposes.

enumValues.name: FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Fulfilled**. All of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: IN_PROGRESS
enumValues.description: Displayed as **In progress**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled, or a request for fulfillment has been sent to the fulfillment service.

enumValues.name: ON_HOLD
enumValues.description: Displayed as **On hold**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are on hold.

enumValues.name: OPEN
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Open**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled. Replaced by "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: PARTIALLY_FULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Partially fulfilled**. Some of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

enumValues.name: PENDING_FULFILLMENT
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Pending fulfillment**. A request for fulfillment of some items awaits a response from the fulfillment service. Replaced by "IN_PROGRESS" status.

enumValues.name: RESTOCKED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Restocked**. All of the items in the order have been restocked. Replaced by "UNFULFILLED" status.

enumValues.name: SCHEDULED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Scheduled**. All of the unfulfilled items in this order are scheduled for fulfillment at later time.

enumValues.name: UNFULFILLED
enumValues.description: Displayed as **Unfulfilled**. None of the items in the order have been fulfilled.

types.name: SellingPlan
types.description: Represents how products and variants can be sold and purchased.

fields.name: description
fields.description: The description of the selling plan.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A globally-unique identifier.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the selling plan. For example, '6 weeks of prepaid granola, delivered weekly'.

fields.name: options
fields.description: The selling plan options available in the drop-down list in the storefront. For example, 'Delivery every week' or 'Delivery every 2 weeks' specifies the delivery frequency options for the product.

fields.name: priceAdjustments
fields.description: The price adjustments that a selling plan makes when a variant is purchased with a selling plan.

fields.name: recurringDeliveries
fields.description: Whether purchasing the selling plan will result in multiple deliveries.

types.name: SellingPlanAllocation
types.description: Represents an association between a variant and a selling plan. Selling plan allocations describe the options offered for each variant, and the price of the variant when purchased with a selling plan.

fields.name: priceAdjustments
fields.description: A list of price adjustments, with a maximum of two. When there are two, the first price adjustment goes into effect at the time of purchase, while the second one starts after a certain number of orders. A price adjustment represents how a selling plan affects pricing when a variant is purchased with a selling plan. Prices display in the customer's currency if the shop is configured for it.

fields.name: sellingPlan
fields.description: A representation of how products and variants can be sold and purchased. For example, an individual selling plan could be '6 weeks of prepaid granola, delivered weekly'.

types.description: An auto-generated type for paginating through multiple SellingPlanAllocations.

fields.description: A list of edges.

fields.description: Information to aid in pagination.

fields.description: A cursor for use in pagination.

fields.description: The item at the end of SellingPlanAllocationEdge.

types.name: SellingPlanAllocationPriceAdjustment
types.description: The resulting prices for variants when they're purchased with a specific selling plan.

fields.name: compareAtPrice
fields.description: The price of the variant when it's purchased without a selling plan for the same number of deliveries. For example, if a customer purchases 6 deliveries of $10.00 granola separately, then the price is 6 x $10.00 = $60.00.

fields.name: perDeliveryPrice
fields.description: The effective price for a single delivery. For example, for a prepaid subscription plan that includes 6 deliveries at the price of $48.00, the per delivery price is $8.00.

fields.name: price
fields.description: The price of the variant when it's purchased with a selling plan For example, for a prepaid subscription plan that includes 6 deliveries of $10.00 granola, where the customer gets 20% off, the price is 6 x $10.00 x 0.80 = $48.00.

fields.name: unitPrice
fields.description: The resulting price per unit for the variant associated with the selling plan. If the variant isn't sold by quantity or measurement, then this field returns `null`.

fields.description: A list of selling plans in a selling plan group. A selling plan is a representation of how products and variants can be sold and purchased. For example, an individual selling plan could be '6 weeks of prepaid granola, delivered weekly'.

types.name: TransactionKind
types.description: The different kinds of order transactions.

enumValues.name: AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description:
An amount reserved against the cardholder's funding source.
Money does not change hands until the authorization is captured.

enumValues.name: CAPTURE
enumValues.description: A transfer of the money that was reserved during the authorization stage.

enumValues.name: CHANGE
enumValues.description: Money returned to the customer when they have paid too much.

enumValues.name: EMV_AUTHORIZATION
enumValues.description: An authorization for a payment taken with an EMV credit card reader.

enumValues.name: SALE
enumValues.description: An authorization and capture performed together in a single step.

types.name: TransactionStatus
types.description: Transaction statuses describe the status of a transaction.

enumValues.name: ERROR
enumValues.description: There was an error while processing the transaction.

types.name: URL

Represents an [RFC 3986](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3986) and
[RFC 3987](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc3987)-compliant URI string.

For example, `"https://johns-apparel.myshopify.com"` is a valid URL. It includes a scheme (`https`) and a host
(`johns-apparel.myshopify.com`).

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: VARIABLE_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a variable definition.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name, description and optional `specifiedByURL`, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields`, `interfaces`, and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

directives.name: accessRestricted
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as having restricted access.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains the reason around this restriction

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted using the Markdown syntax, as specified by [CommonMark](https://commonmark.org/).

directives.name: inContext
directives.description: Contextualizes data based on the additional information provided by the directive. For example, you can use the `@inContext(country: CA)` directive to [query a product's price](https://shopify.dev/api/examples/international-pricing#query-product-prices) in a storefront within the context of Canada.

args.name: country
args.description: The country code for context. For example, `CA`.

args.name: language
args.description: The language code for context. For example, `EN`.

args.name: preferredLocationId
args.description: The identifier of the customer's preferred location.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Included when true.

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

args.name: if
args.description: Skipped when true.

directives.name: specifiedBy
directives.description: Exposes a URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.

args.name: url
args.description: The URL that specifies the behavior of this scalar.
